title: Saudi Deal With Iran Surprises Israel and Jolts Netanyahu
description: Israel had long hoped to isolate Iran and seal ties with Saudi Arabia. A thaw between Riyadh and Tehran has complicated that goal — and was perceived as politically damaging to the prime minister.

title: Canadian Supreme Court Judge on Leave During Review of Altercation in Arizona
description: The judge denied instigating the episode, which an oversight council has been investigating for several weeks.

title: After Years of Bickering, France and Britain Look for a New Start
description: The rapport between Emmanuel Macron of France and Prime Minister Rishi Sunak of Britain hints at a mending of their countries’ relationship.

title: At the End of a Hard Journey, Migrants Face Another: Navigating Bureaucracy
description: The Biden administration’s new rules have brought down a record number of border crossings, but critics say they expose the pitfalls of policies intended to manage an immediate problem.

title: Traute Lafrenz, Last Survivor of Anti-Hitler Group, Dies at 103
description: As a member of the White Rose, a small anti-Nazi resistance group, she used peaceful tactics to try persuading Germans to turn against Hitler.

title: Interpreting the Week’s Most Important Stories
description: The larger themes behind the protests in Israel, the U.K.’s tough new immigration plan and a fight over U.S. labor unions.

title: What to Know About the Iranian-Saudi Deal
description: The regional rivals have agreed to re-establish diplomatic ties in an agreement brokered by China that could reverberate across the Middle East and beyond.

title: Funeral for Dmytro Kotsiubailo, Known as ‘Da Vinci,’ Draws Crowds in Kyiv
description: Dmytro Kotsiubailo, better known as “Da Vinci,” was killed near Bakhmut on March 7.

title: Pregnant Russians Flock to Argentina to Gain a Shot at Citizenship
description: Since the Ukraine war, pregnant Russians have been flocking to the South American country where obtaining citizenship is relatively easy — if your child is born there.

title: The leaders of Britain and France met in Paris with Ukraine on the agenda.
Giving the Middle Finger Is a ‘God-Given’ Right, a Quebec Judge Says
description: In dismissing a harassment case, the judge wrote that the right to make the obscene gesture is one that “that belongs to every red-blooded Canadian.”

title: A (Literal) Passport Out of Russia: Give Birth in Argentina
description: Since the Ukraine war, pregnant Russians have been flocking to the South American country where obtaining citizenship is relatively easy — if your child is born there.

title: Saudi Arabia and Iran Agree to Re-establish Ties in Major Regional Shift
description: The two regional rivals agreed to reactivate a lapsed security cooperation agreement as well as older trade, investment and cultural pacts.

title: Prince Edward Receives a New Title on His Birthday
description: King Charles III named Edward, his youngest brother, the Duke of Edinburgh on his 59th birthday. The title was previously held by their father, Prince Philip.

title: Gunman Kills 6 in Shooting at Jehovah’s Witness Hall in Germany
description: The authorities in Hamburg said the attacker, who was believed to have killed himself after police officers arrived at the scene, appeared to have been driven by anger at religious groups.

title: Why Unions Matter So Much
description: Is the Democratic Party again starting to pay more attention to them?

title: U.S. Rocket System Gives Ukraine a Leg Up in Tough Fights
description: A New York Times team was given a rare chance to witness the weapon, the American-developed M270 Multiple Launch Rocket System, in operation near the front line in eastern Ukraine. Here is what we’re covering:

title: Why Russia Has Such a Strong Grip on Europe’s Nuclear Power
description: New energy sources to replace oil and natural gas have been easier to find than kicking the dependency on Rosatom, the state-owned nuclear superstore.

title: Georgia Drops ‘Foreign Agents’ Bill That Set Off Protests Over Parallels to Russia
description: Although the U-turn was considered a victory for civil society, activists on both sides of the issue suggested that the fight was not over.

title: Here’s why experts are concerned about the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant’s safety risks.
description: The nuclear plant, the largest in Europe, has been forced to resort to its emergency diesel generators six times since Russia launched its full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

title: Israel Judicial Overhaul: What Led to Protests of Netanyahu’s Plan
description: Israeli society is locked in a deep dispute over the future of its judiciary and democracy. The conflict is rooted in shifts of the last three decades.

title: Biden and E.U. Leader to Discuss Ukraine and Trade Spat
description: President Biden and the European Commission president are set to discuss how to effectively counter Russia and a potential trade deal for electric vehicles.

title: Israel Prepares for World Baseball Classic
description: Israel’s World Baseball Classic roster is stacked with American major leaguers connecting with their Jewish heritage. In a tough group, they are still underdogs.

title: Legacy of Australia’s Immigration Policies Haunts Survivors and Supporters
description: The country’s grueling detention programs have ensnared thousands — and appear to flout international law.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: The toll of Russia’s Thursday morning assault on Ukraine.

title: Xi Jinping Picks Team to Work Under Him for the Next Five Years
description: As Xi Jinping starts his third term as president, he is pushing sweeping changes to the rest of the country’s leadership to elevate his allies.

title: Xi Jinping Starts New Term in China, With a Focus on Economy and U.S. Rivalry
description: The Communist Party-controlled legislature, the National People’s Congress, endorsed Xi Jinping for president in a ritual ballot.

title: Saudi Arabia Offers Its Price to Normalize Relations With Israel
description: The Saudi crown prince is seeking a civilian nuclear program and security assurances from President Biden, a steep price for an agreement long sought by Israel.

title: Russia Blasts Ukrainian Cities, Including Biggest Use of Advanced Missiles
description: Of 81 missiles fired, six were hypersonic weapons, among Russia’s newest and most advanced, which are all but impossible to shoot down. The attacks killed at least nine people.
